intro: Otanthera subrostrata, commonly known as the western evening primrose, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Onagraceae and is characterized by its showy, yellow-orange flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant has hairy, upright stems and lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine pubescence. Its seeds are enclosed in a capsule that splits open to release the seeds when mature. Otanthera subrostrata is often found in dry, disturbed soils and is adapted to arid environments.
